description: A batch of NMT translation evaluations.

items.description: Evaluation scores for each single translation.

adequacy.description: Assessment of how well the meaning of the source is preserved.

score.description: 5=complete meaning preserved, 4=minor meaning issues, 3=partial meaning loss, 2=major meaning errors, 1=meaning not preserved

description.description: A comment explaining scores 1-4, or an empty string if 5.

fluency.description: Assessment of grammatical and stylistic fluency.

score.description: 5=fluent and natural, 4=minor grammatical issues, 3=awkward but understandable, 2=difficult to understand, 1=ungrammatical or nonsensical

description.description: A comment explaining an fluency score below 5, or an empty string.

terminology.description: Assessment of correct use of domain-specific terminology.

score.description: 5=correct and consistent use, 4=minor inconsistency or misuse, 3=some incorrect or inconsistent terms, 2=frequent term issues, 1=terminology mostly incorrect

description.description: Optional comment explaining the terminology score.

hallucination.description: Assessment of fabricated or unrelated content.

score.description: 5=no hallucinations, 4=minor unsupported additions, 3=some invented content, 2=frequent hallucinations, 1=hallucinated most content

description.description: Optional comment explaining the hallucination score.

score.description: 5=punctuation is appropriate and matches expectations 4=minor punctuation issues (e.g., missing stylistic marks) 3=some punctuation errors or inconsistencies 2=frequent punctuation problems 1=punctuation is largely incorrect or absent

description.description: Optional comment explaining the punctuation score.

summary.description: Evaluator's overall commentary summarizing trends across all evaluated segments.

adequacy.description: e.g. Most translations retained the main meaning of the source, with occasional omissions or shifts in nuance. A few misrepresented roles or introduced unclear phrasing, but full meaning loss was rare. The overall message typically came through clearly.

fluency.description: e.g. Translations were generally smooth and grammatically sound. Minor awkwardness or unnatural phrasing appeared infrequently and rarely impaired understanding. The tone aligned well with standard written Spanish.

terminology.description: e.g. Terminology use was mostly accurate but uneven. Some mistranslations stemmed from literal mappings or confusion between similar words. Name and title inconsistencies appeared occasionally but did not dominate.

hallucination.description: e.g. Hallucinations were rare. The model usually stayed faithful to the source, with only slight deviations or interpretive rewording. Fabricated content was virtually nonexistent.

punctuation.description: e.g. Punctuation was mostly correct, though inconsistencies surfaced in quotation marks and comma placement. These were minor and didnâ€™t significantly affect readability. Spanish norms were followed in most cases.
